# Task

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example



# Data

wrap_string("This function will wrap words into lines")

# Define the function
def wrap_string(text):
words = text.split()
result = []
current_line = words[0]

for word in words:
if len(current_line) + len(word) + 1 <= 10:
current_line += " " + word
else:
result.append(current_line)
current_line = word

# Add the last line to the result
result.append(current_line)

return '\n'.join(result)

# Test the function with provided data
text = "This function will wrap words into lines"
print(wrap_string(text))
